data.title: Gazette Obituaries
data.meta_description: PORT JERVIS — Mary W. McAfee of Port Jervis died Jan. 14, 2014, at St. Joseph's Place, Port Jervis. She was 87.
data.text:
BARBARA PECK

PENN YAN — Barbara Peck, recently of Penn Yan, died Jan. 18, 2014. She was 73.

She was born in Port Jervis, the daughter of the late John F. Osterhout and Phyllis Bodensieck.

She is survived by her husband of 49 years, Peter Peck; her children: Mark (Ann) of North Las Vegas, Nev., and Lara McCarthy (James Jr.) of Rockville Centre; her grandchildren, Peter, Ryan and Kailey; and her brother, John Osterhout, (Denise) of Glen Spey.

Barb was a graduate of Port Jervis High School and Orange County Community College. She worked in the travel industry and was an EMT with Perinton Ambulance.

Barb will be remembered for her heirloom counter-cross stitching, decadent chocolate desserts, sunsets on Keuka Lake, Bermuda holidays and being a friend to many.

Honoring her wishes, there will be no calling hours or service. A celebration of her life will be held at the convenience of the family.

In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions can be made to Keuka Comfort Care Home in Penn Yan or Northwestern University's Cognitive Neurology and Alzheimer's Disease Center (CNADC).

Fiuneral arrangements are by Weldon Funeral Home, 102 E. Main St., Penn Yan.

Tristan Alexander Raap

MIDDLETOWN — Tristan Alexander Raap of Middletown died Jan. 19, 2014, at Orange Regional Medical Center. He was 6.

He was born June 26, 2007, in Hackensack, N.J., the son of Kenneth and Melissa Crum Raap.

Tristan attended school at Orange-Ulster BOCES in Goshen.

A family statement read: "Tristan was an amazing little angel that blessed our family. He opened our hearts and eyes to a love that was priceless. His smile was infectious and he melted hearts with all who was in his life. Our 'Little Man' will be missed by many."

He is survived by his loving parents, Ken and Melissa Raap, of Middletown; his siblings, Stephanie, Kenny and Mary Raap, all at home; paternal grandparents, Ken and Bernadette Raap, of Middletown; maternal grandparents, Randy and Teresa Crum, of Glen Spey; and numerous aunts, uncles and cousins.

Funeral services were held at the Gray-Parker Funeral Home, Port Jervis, Jan. 23, with the Rev. Michael Cedro officiating. Cremation will be at H.G. Smith Crematory, Stroudsburg, Pa.

In lieu of flowers, donations may be made in memory of Tristan to the CDLS Foundation at donate.cdlsusa.org.

Mary W. McAfee

PORT JERVIS — Mary W. McAfee of Port Jervis died Jan. 14, 2014, at St. Joseph's Place, Port Jervis. She was 87.

She was born in Paia, Hawaii, the daughter of the late Theodore and Alberta Agra Balidoy.

Mary was a retired supervisor with the United States military at the Naval Air Station at Barbers Point, Oahu, Hawaii.

After moving to the Port Jervis area, Mary worked as an assembler for Kolmar Labs Inc. in Port Jervis.

She attended the Sparrowbush United Methodist Church in Sparrowbush, with her family.

She married Robert W. McAfee, who predeceased her.

Mary is survived by her sons, Larry McAfee and his wife, Meg, of Texas, and Gary McAfee and his wife, Phillipa, of Glen Spey; her daughters, Beverly Branch and her husband, Buz, of Colorado, Luverne Scully Rohner and her husband, James, of Port Jervis, Doretta Reiss and her husband, Ed, of Glen Spey, Marilyn Sigreto and her husband, Pete, of Matamoras, Pa., Alberta McCullough and her husband, Bruce, of Texas, Kathy Smith and her husband, Gary, of Sparrowbush, Danita McAfee and her companion, Joe, of Pittsburgh, Pa., Teri Guerrero and her husband, Oscar, of Collegeville, Pa., and Penny Lewis and her husband, Rick, of Port Jervis; 20 grandchildren and four great-grandchildren; and several nieces and nephews.

Mary was predeceased by her son Robert McAfee, her granddaughter Sarah McAfee, her sister and three brothers. She was also predeceased by her grandson, Robert McAfee, III.

Visitation and services were held at the Knight-Auchmoody Funeral Home, Port Jervis.

In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made in Mary's name to St. Joseph's Place, 160 E. Main St., Port Jervis, NY 12771.

Arthur "Jack" Cooper, Sr.

PORT JERVIS — Arthur "Jack" Cooper, Sr., of Port Jervis, died Jan. 19, 2014, at Bon Secours Community Hospital, Port Jervis. He was 70.

He was born Sept. 5, 1943, in Port Jervis, the son of the late Arthur J. and Reba Deeble Cooper.

Jack was a retired plant supervisor for Ford Motor Co., at Mawah, N.J. He was a former member of the Port Jervis Lodge of Elks, No. 645, BPOE.

He is survived by his two sons, Thomas A. Cooper of Queens, and Arthur G. Cooper, Jr. and his wife, Melissa, of Yulan; his three grandchildren, Cole Thomas Cooper, Makenna Corrine Cooper, and Chase Arthur Cooper; his sister, Arlene Juarez of Brooksville, Florida, and several nieces and nephews. He is also survived by his former wife, Carol Myer Cooper of Pond Eddy.

Jack was predeceased by his two brothers, Ben and Jimmy Cooper.

Memorial services will be private. Rev. Nancy Vonderhorst will officiate. Arrangements are by the Knight-Auchmoody Funeral Home, Port Jervis.

Robert Allen Quick

PORT JERVIS — Robert Allen Quick of Port Jervis died Jan. 20, 2014, at his home. He was 68.

He was born Dec. 17, 1945, in Middletown, the son of the late Sidney J. and Rose Fiero Quick.

Bob worked as a truck driver for the Delaware Valley Block Co. in Port Jervis. He also worked as a high rise construction supervisor on the Florida Gulf Coast, and for MacLean Trucking Co. in Maybrook. In his earlier years, he worked as an insurance agent for Metropolitan Life Insurance Co. Before his retirement, he was the owner and operator of Wholesale Flowers, Inc., in Port Jervis.

Bob was an active member, deacon, elder and trustee of the First Presbyterian Church in Port Jervis.

He enjoyed, hunting, fishing, motorcycle riding, flea markets, public auctions, Nascar racing, and rock music.

He is survived by his loving wife of 40 years, Barbara J. Gibbs Quick, at home; his four sons: Jason Quick of Sauk Rapids, Minnesota, Ryan Quick and his wife Jenna of Glen Spey, John Quick and his companion Lisa Perosi of Sparrowbush, and Robert Scott Quick and his wife Brenda of Port Jervis; his daughter, Connie Liston of Port Jervis and her husband Jackie of Deberry, Texas; his sister, Carol Langlitz and her husband Mel of Thompson Ridge; his brother, Sidney Quick and his wife Marie of Otisville; and his grandchildren: Teagan, Everleigh, Nathan, Trey, Savannah, Natalya, Courtney, Cassie, Travis and Keith. He is also survived by his former wife, Sharon Weyer of Waynesboro, Virginia, and several nieces and nephews.

Bob was predeceased by his daughter Erin, his son Brian, his granddaughter Shantai, and his twin brother, Ralph Quick.

The family will receive friends from 11 a.m.-noon Jan. 31 at the First Presbyterian Church, 60 Sussex St., Port Jervis. Funeral services will follow at noon at the First Presbyterian Church with Rev. Ann Akers officiating. Interment will be private.

Memorial contributions may be made to the First Presbyterian Church, 60 Sussex St., Port Jervis, NY 12771 or to a charity of donor's choice.

Arrangements are by the Knight-Auchmoody Funeral Home, Port Jervis.

Gray-Parker Funeral Home, 100 E. Main St., Port Jervis, NY 12771; send condolences via grayparkerfuneralhome.com.

Knight-Auchmoody Funeral Home, 154 E. Main St., Port Jervis, NY 12771; send condolences via knight-auchmoody.com.
